sen.j: 佐伯男（さえきのおとこ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: SAEKI no Otoko (years of birth and death unknown) is Japanese of Asuka period.
SAEKI no Otoko (years of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 文意がより明らかになるよう英文を修正しました。
sen.e: SAEKI no Otoko (years of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「さへきのをとこ」。
sen.e: The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is 'SAHEKI no Wotoko.'
The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is 'SAHEKI no Wotoko.'
The reading of the name in old Japanese syllabary is 'SAHEKI no Wotoko.'

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は連、後に宿禰。
sen.e: Kabane (hereditary title) is Muraji, and Sukune later.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji, and Sukune later.
sen.cmt: 時制を修正しました。Kabaneはhis kabaneと修正しました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji, and Sukune later.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大友皇子（弘文天皇）のため筑紫国に遣わされたが任務に失敗した。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, he was dispatched to Tsukushi Province for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) but failed his duty.
In Jinshin War of 672, he was dispatched to Tsukushi Province for Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun) but failed his duty.
sen.cmt: 「（後の）弘文天皇」と解釈してlaterを補足しました。
sen.e: In Jinshin War of 672, he was dispatched to Tsukushi Province for Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun) but failed his duty.
He became Oyamato no kami (a director general of Japan) later, and a Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade.
sen.cmt: 「大倭」の定訳がTaiとなっていましたが、Oyamatoと読んでいる資料が多かったためこちらを使用しました。また、「守」について定訳不明のため、director generalと訳出しました。
sen.e: He later became Oyamato no kami (a director general of Japan) of Jugoinojo (a Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 役職名と官位の関係が不明瞭なのでofを補足しました。
sen.e: He later became Oyamato no kami (a director general of Japan) of Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月下旬、大海人皇子（天武天皇）の挙兵を知った近江宮の朝廷は、各地に使者を派遣して鎮圧のための軍を興させた。
sen.e: In the end of June, 672 the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac), Omi no miya Imperial Court which knew Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) raised an army dispatched the envoys to many parts of the country and raised the army for its suppression.

In the end of June, 672 the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac), Omi no miya Imperial Court which knew Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) had raised an army dispatched the envoys to many parts of the country and raised the army for its suppression.
sen.cmt: 最初のraisedはhad raisedと過去完了にするべきだと思われます。
sen.e: In the end of June, 672 the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac), Omi no miya Imperial Court which knew Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) had raised an army dispatched the envoys to many parts of the country and raised the army for its suppression.

sen.j: 佐伯連男はこのとき筑紫大宰の栗隈王に遣わされた。
sen.e: SAEKI no Muraji no Otoko was dispatched to Prince Kurikuma, Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa (provincial governor-general) on this occasion.
SAEKI no Muraji no Otoko was dispatched to Prince Kurikuma, Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa (provincial governor-general) on this occasion.
SAEKI no Muraji no Otoko was dispatched to Prince Kurikuma, Tsukushi no Omikotomochi no Tsukasa (provincial governor-general) on this occasion.

sen.j: 出兵を命じたものの、栗隈王が以前大海人皇子に従っていたことから、彼もまた背くかもしれないと弘文天皇は疑っていた。
sen.e: While Emperor Kobun commanded dispatch of troops, Emperor Kobun suspected that he would betray again because Prince Kurikuma used to obey Prince Oama before.
While Emperor Kobun commanded dispatch of troops, the emperor suspected that Saeki would also betray because Prince Kurikuma used to obey Prince Oama before.
sen.cmt: 文意からしてagainではなくalsoが適切と思われます。
sen.e: While Emperor Kobun commanded dispatch of troops, the emperor suspected that Saeki would also betray because Prince Kurikuma used to obey Prince Oama before.

sen.j: 「従わない様子があったら殺せ」というのが、佐伯男が受けた指示であった。
sen.e: The direction SAEKI no Otoko received was 'Kill him if he is disobedient.'
The direction SAEKI no Otoko had received was 'Kill him if he is disobedient.'
sen.cmt: receivedは過去形ではなく過去完了形が適切と思われます。
sen.e: The direction SAEKI no Otoko had received was 'Kill him if he is disobedient.'

sen.j: 符（命令書）を受けとった栗隈王は、出兵を断った。
sen.e: Prince Kurikuma who received the order to dispatch troops rejected it.
Prince Kurikuma who received the order to dispatch troops rejected it.
Prince Kurikuma who received the order to dispatch troops rejected it.

sen.j: 筑紫国の務めは国外への備えであり、守りを空けたときに変事があったら国が傾くというのが、栗隈王が述べた理由であった。
sen.e: The reason Prince Kurikuma said was that the duty in Tsukushi Province was for the provision against outside and the nation which had an accident during the defense's absence would decline.
Prince Kurikuma explained that the duty in Tsukushi Province was for the provision against outside and the nation which had an accident during the defense's absence would decline.
sen.cmt: The reason Prince Kurikuma said was thatの表現が不自然なので修正しました。
sen.e: Prince Kurikuma explained that the duty in Tsukushi Province was for the provision against outside and the nation which had an accident during the defense's absence would decline.

sen.j: このとき、栗駒王の二人の子、三野王（美努王）と武家王が剣を佩いて側に立っていた。
sen.e: Prince Kumakuri's two children, Prince Mino (Prince Minu) and Prince Takeie equipped with swords and stood beside him.
Prince Kumakuri's two children, Prince Mino (Prince Minu) and Prince Takeie were equipped with swords and stood beside him.
sen.cmt: equipped withはwere equipped withと受身にするのが適切と思われます。
sen.e: Prince Kumakuri's two children, Prince Mino (Prince Minu) and Prince Takeie were equipped with swords and stood beside him.

sen.j: 佐伯男は剣を握って前に出ようとしたが、かえって自分が殺されるかもしれないと考え、断念してそのまま帰った。
sen.e: SAEKI no Otoko tried to step forward with his sword, but gave up and returned since he thought to be killed instead.
SAEKI no Otoko tried to step forward with his sword in his hand, but gave up and returned since he thought to be killed instead.
sen.cmt: 「剣を握って」はin his handを補った方が文意がより明らかになると思われます。
sen.e: SAEKI no Otoko tried to step forward with his sword in his hand, but gave up and returned since he thought to be killed instead.

sen.j: 帰還後の活動については記録がない。
sen.e: There is no record of activities after his return.
There is no record of his activities after his return.
sen.cmt: activitiesの後にhisを補足しました。
sen.e: There is no record of his activities after his return.

sen.j: 乱の後に赦されたと考えられる。
sen.e: It seems that he was forgiven after the War.
It seems that he was forgiven after the War.
It seems that he was forgiven after the War.

sen.j: 佐伯連は、天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日に宿禰の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: SAEKI no Muraji was given the kabane of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary title) on December 2, 684.
SAEKI no Muraji was given the kabane of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary title) on December 2, 684.
SAEKI no Muraji was given the kabane of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary title) on January 15, 685.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）3月13日、従五位下の佐伯宿祢男は、大倭守（大和国の守）に任命された。
sen.e: SAEKI no Sukune no Otoko, the Junior Fifth Rank Lower Grade, was assigned to Oyamato no kami (a director general of Japan) on March 13, 708.
sen.cmt: 「守」について定訳不明のため、director generalと訳出しました。
sen.e: SAEKI no Sukune no Otoko, the Junior Fifth Rank Lower Grade, was assigned to Oyamato no kami (a director general of Japan) on March 13, 708.
SAEKI no Sukune no Otoko, the Junior Fifth Rank Lower Grade, was assigned to Oyamato no kami (a director general of Japan) on April 12, 708.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 翌2年（709年）9月2日に、従五位下から従五位上に昇進した。
sen.e: On September 2, 709, he was raised from the Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade to the Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade.
On September 2, 709, he was raised from the Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade to the Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade.
On October 13, 709, he was raised from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Jugoinojo.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。JugoinogeおよびJugoinojoを補足しました。

sen.j: このときも大倭守であった。
sen.e: He was also Oyamato no kami then.
He was also Oyamato no kami then.
He was also Oyamato no kami then.
